formattedAddress: 245 Murray St, New York, NY 10282, USA
adrFormatAddress: 245 Murray St, New York, NY 10282-5651, USA

originalText.text:
We came to New York for vacation and We went to Friedman’s for brunch on a Monday. It was Christmas so we were happy to find a brunch spot opened.
From the service to the delicious food, everything was excellent.
I had the chicken and waffle and my husband had the steak frites. We also ordered to go the lemon ricotta pancakes and tried it at home. You must get that!!
We will definitely come back.

text.text:
We came to New York for vacation and We went to Friedman’s for brunch on a Monday. It was Christmas so we were happy to find a brunch spot opened.
From the service to the delicious food, everything was excellent.
I had the chicken and waffle and my husband had the steak frites. We also ordered to go the lemon ricotta pancakes and tried it at home. You must get that!!
We will definitely come back.

originalText.text: Food was excellent and so many gluten-free options! We loved the GF Chicken and Waffles and it was big enough that we could have almost shared it. The non-GH French Toast was also delicious. Worth come backing over and over!

text.text: Food was excellent and so many gluten-free options! We loved the GF Chicken and Waffles and it was big enough that we could have almost shared it. The non-GH French Toast was also delicious. Worth come backing over and over!

originalText.text:
I was here before renovations and I didn’t like it then and still don’t like it now.  The ambiance was always off and a bit too bright.  Even after renovations, you still have the very cheap furniture and still off lighting (Some dim orange) which feels like previous off lighting.  I think the bar is worst now because you have to walk all the way to other end when the bar should come before dining room.  They have a chance to stretch bar across the room but instead they have a sushi bar but no chairs to sushi bar?  Makes zero sense here.

To be fair, I gave it a chance and went multiple times.  Had the fried chicken and it was dry and flavorless.  Just chewing and filled me up but not tasty at all.  Yuka Fries not bad but the awful spicy sauce it came with was awful.  Another time I tried their club sandwich which tasted fine but look at my picture of club with literally only two slices of turkey and compare the club on their website where they show it stacked with turkey meat.  I can go to any average diner and turkey club wud be stacked with turkey.  The bagel shop next door wud stack it as well.  Cheapos.  I tried Chef Wu dumplings and the sweet and sour sauce was awful.  The last thing I tried was actually not too bad which was the spicy beef noodles which to my surprise came with five large slices of briskets.  Did I get lucky or is this the norm?  However, there was nothing spicy about the noodle soup.

I think this neighborhood is just cursed with awful restaurants.

originalText.text: We had such a great time for lunch at Friedmans! Delicious Dumplings and Pastrami  (I know, such an abnormal combo!). Would highly recommend. Their menu offers something for everyone, and their staff were super friendly.

text.text: We had such a great time for lunch at Friedmans! Delicious Dumplings and Pastrami  (I know, such an abnormal combo!). Would highly recommend. Their menu offers something for everyone, and their staff were super friendly.

originalText.text: Had lunch on grand opening day here with a few coworkers and everything tasted really great! They have an extremely extensive menu with a lot of vegetarian/gf options as well

text.text: Had lunch on grand opening day here with a few coworkers and everything tasted really great! They have an extremely extensive menu with a lot of vegetarian/gf options as well
